meanings.definition: A person who believes that only the self exists and that all other beings are merely projections of one's own mind.
meanings.sent1: Some solipsists think that everything around them is just a creation of their own thoughts.
meanings.sent2: Solipsists often ponder the idea that everything outside themselves might not truly exist.
meanings.sent3: The solipsists at the party joked that they were the only real guests there.
meanings.sent4: In a world of solipsists, each person would be the center of their own universe.
meanings.sent5: The concept of solipsists can be both fascinating and isolating.

meanings.definition: Those who adhere to the philosophical idea that the self is the only thing that can be known to exist.
meanings.sent1: Many solipsists find comfort in the belief that only their own existence is certain.
meanings.sent2: The solipsists in the debate argued passionately for the limits of human knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The solipsists in the library were convinced they were the only ones truly reading.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of solipsists, each person's reality would be their own island.
meanings.sent5: The philosophy of solipsists challenges traditional views of reality.
